alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Port Wentworth to Pritchardville to near Bluffton. As much as 1 to 3.5 inches of rain has already fallen in this area today. With another 1 to 2 inches of rain possible, there is a risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas through 745 PM. - As of 620 PM, the Bluffton Police Department had measured 3.80 inches of rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluffton, Hardeeville, Pritchardville, Levy, Limehouse, Palmetto Bluff and Myrtle Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
